cmCourseInfo.description: A formal opportunity to gain hands-on experience and develop their skills within a research laboratory setting. Students will have a chance to become familiar and efficient at good lab practices, develop critical thinking and evaluation skills while applying their knowledge and developing trouble shooting skills to practical research questions. This course is Pass/Fail. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Research Experience in Pharmacology & Toxicology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: None; Permission of Faculty Supervisor and Departmental Undergraduate Coordinator required.
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: Completion of at least first year of Life Sciences program.

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students enroll in this course through the Department. Please contact course coordinator: Dr. Hamadani at anita.hamadanizadeh@utoronto.ca

Delivery Instructions

This is an independent research project course with no formal lecture schedule. Students are required to secure their own supervisor for the course. 

If Public Health and institutional guidelines allow, and by mutual agreement of the student and faculty supervisor, in-person meetings may be arranged.

This course is Pass/Fail. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.

courses.name: Research Abroad in Pharmacology and Toxicology

cmCourseInfo.description: An independent research project in a pharmacology and/or toxicology laboratory in an approved partner university. This international research experience will be supervised by a faculty member at the partner institution and will allow students to develop critical thinking and evaluation skills while applying their knowledge and trouble shooting skills to practical research questions. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Research Abroad in Pharmacology and Toxicology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PCL201H1 (65%), PSL300H1 (65%), PSL301H1 (65%); permission from the Undergraduate Coordinator

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students enroll in this course through the Department. Application through the Center for International Exchange (CIE) required. Please email undergrad.pharmtox@utoronto.ca.

Delivery Instructions

Health and safety guidelines and University travel policy will determine the status of this opportunity at the time of study.

cmCourseInfo.description: This course affords students an opportunity for hands-on research experience in a laboratory or applied pharmacology setting. Students will work under the supervision of a faculty member and will submit a final written report and oral presentation. Enrollment is limited and requires permission from the Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology. It is the student’s responsibility to secure a placement with an approved supervisor before the course begins (a list of potential supervisors can be obtained from the Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology). Students will be registered in the course once their ballot form (obtained from the Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology) is signed by an approved supervisor and approved by the Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology. Students are expected to spend approximately 200 hours towards this project but this will be project/supervisor dependent. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Project in Pharmacology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PCL201H1, PCL302H1, PCL366H1/PCL367H1/PCL368H1, STA288H1/PCL376H1, and permission of Department

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

This is a remote, hybrid course. The course will run primarily as asynchronous (i.e., students will work directly with their supervisor on project requirements), with some synchronous online meeting components to be determined at the outset of the course with the course coordinator. 


Students enroll in this course through the Department. Please email undergrad.pharmtox@utoronto.ca.

Delivery Instructions

LEC0101/LEC9101 - learning for this course is self-paced and not reliant on a meeting schedule. There are no formal lecture meetings as part of this course. 

If Public Health and institutional guidelines allow, and by mutual agreement of the student and faculty supervisor, in-person meetings may be arranged.

cmCourseInfo.description: This course affords students an opportunity for hands-on research experience in a laboratory or applied toxicology setting. Students will work under the supervision of a staff member and will submit a final written report and oral presentation. Enrollment is limited and requires permission from the Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology. It is the student’s responsibility to secure a placement with an approved supervisor before the course begins (a list of potential supervisors can be obtained from the Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology). Students will be registered in the course once their ballot form (obtained from the Department of Pharmacology) is signed by an approved supervisor and approved by the Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology. Students are expected to spend approximately 200 hours towards this project but this will be project/supervisor dependent. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Project in Toxicology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PCL201H1, PCL302H1, PCL366H1/PCL367H1/PCL368H1, STA288H1/PCL376H1, and permission of Department
